STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 3, 2023
Timothy Nelson
KENT COUNTY JUVENILE DETENTION CENTER
1501 CEDAR ST,
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49503-1300
Re: License #: CO410201223
Investigation #: 2023C0000784SI
Dear Mr. Nelson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually implicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CO410201223
Licensee Group Organization: 17th Circuit Court Family Division
Licensee Designee: Timothy Nelson
Chief Administrator: Timothy Nelson
Agency Name: KENT COUNTY JUVENILE DETENTION
CENTER
Agency Address: 1501 CEDAR ST
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49503-1300
License Status: Inspected
License Expiration Date: 09/30/2025
Capacity: 98
II. METHODOLOGY

Initiation

Evaluation

9/26/2023 4:30 PM Face to Face Interview
9/27/2023 7:44 AM Email Documentation received or
sent ;Other
9/27/2023 8:15 AM Phone Consultation Provided; Other
1

9/27/2023 1:30 PM Face to Face Interview
9/29/2023 9:15 AM Text Other
9/29/2023 9:20 AM Phone Other
9/29/2023 4:00 PM Phone Interview
10/2/2023 2:45 PM Face to Face Interview
10/2/2023 4:00 PM Face to Face Interview
10/4/2023 2:30 PM Phone Other
10/9/2023 3:30 PM Phone Other
10/23/2023 11:00 AM Video Conference MDHHS Pre-Disposition
Meeting- Findings
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures,
Section establishment
Description (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth and therapist at facility have been engaging in text
message communication. Therapist's text messages were sexual
in nature.
Investigation Interviews:
Probation Officer 2/ Compliant Source was interviewed face to face
at the facility on September 26, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Probation Officer 2 reported he received a copy of the
concerning text messages between Probation Officer 1 and Youth A
from Youth A’s Mother after Youth A returned back from his home pass.
He reported Youth A is on his current caseload so there should be no
reason why Youth A should have Probation Officer 1’s phone number.
He reported when a youth is on a home pass about every six hours the
probation officer from the facility needs to do a phone check-in with the
youth’s parent. Probation Officer 2 reported when he does a check-in it
is through his work phone not through his personal phone. He reported
when the youth are about to discharge from the program, they complete
the circle of support which is a list of people they contact when they
need support. Probation Officer 2 reported only one staff member from
the facility can be on the circle of support from the facility and that staff
member has to sign off by giving the facility’s phone number not their
personal. When asked about the professionalism of Probation Officer 1
with the youth, he expressed concerns that Probation Officer 1 acted
more friendly with the youth and that he would have to remind her about
2

professionalism. Probation Officer 2 reported within their role as
probation officers they should not be on the unit as much and their work
with the youth occurs more within the probation officer's office to work
on therapy. He reported Probation Officer 1 had to be reminded of this
multiple times because she would go on the unit more and was more
playful with the youth. Probation Officer 2 reported he has expressed
these concerns with Chief Administrator and Supervisor. He reported
within his role at the facility he needs to remain professional with the
youth and never cross that friendship boundary. Probation Officer 2
reported he would never give his personal phone number out.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
26, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he
is residing in the treatment program within the facility and is getting
discharged in a couple of days. He reported his probation officer through
the program is Probation Officer 2 and he really enjoys working with him.
Youth A reported due to him being released soon he has been doing
some home passes and Probation Officer 2 has done some phone
check-ins with his mom while Youth A is out on pass. He reported he
only talks with Probation Officer 1 when she does groups and just has
quick one-on-one conversations. Youth A denied ever having
conversations with Probation Officer 1 outside the facility. When
MDHHS Worker brought up the concerns about the text messages that
were seen on the phone, Youth A shut down and refused to complete
the rest of the interview and requested to go back to his pod.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the county jail on
September 27, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported he was in the treatment program and discharged on June 5,
2023. He reported his assigned probation officer at the facility was
Probation Officer 2. He reported when he was discharged from the
program later his mom received a check-in call from Probation Officer 1
and Youth B talked to her on his mom's phone. Youth B reported during
that conversation he gave his phone number to Probation Officer 1 and
they began texting every day or every other day. He reported they would
text about how each other were and the topic of sex was brought up
before. When asked to explain more about what that conversation was,
Youth B reported they talked about some stuff and when asked to
explain more he stated it was just “sex stuff.” He reported they could not
talk that much about it because he needed to be 18 and off probation.
Youth B reported he never met up with Probation Officer 1 outside of the
facility and was never connected with her social media. He reported he
heard from Youth E that Probation Officer 1 was also talking with him.
He reported his mom did not know he was talking to Probation Officer 1
on his phone. Youth B reported he was brought back to detention on
June 29, 2023, and was brought to county jail due to his charges. He
reported that since he has been in county jail he has tried to contact
Probation Officer 1 via phone calls a few times and she only answered
the phone once. Youth B reported that phone call was appropriate as
she just asked how he was.
3

Probation Officer 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 26, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Probation
Officer 1 reported she heard about the text messages from Supervisor
and Chief Administrator yesterday and reported that was not her texting
Youth A. She reported she believes it was her boyfriend who was texting
Youth A. Probation Officer 1 reported her relationship with her boyfriend
is unhealthy as there is a domestic violence case open between them.
She reported she saw her boyfriend over the weekend once she got out
of work on Friday and reported not having her phone with her until she
left him on Sunday. Probation Officer 1 reported she knew he went
through her phone because due to his controlling nature, he needs to
have all her passwords and when she opened her phone all text
messages were deleted. She reported she has confronted her boyfriend
about what he did, and he has stated to her that since she “fucked up”
his life with these domestic violence charges that he is going to “fuck
her” life by this. When asked how her boyfriend could be so specific with
the youth’s first and last names in the text messages, Probation Officer
reported as a part of her boyfriend’s control she needs to give him every
detail of her day and she discloses the youth’s names. She reported she
did not think was a big deal because she had overheard Supervisor
saying she had talked to her husband about the youth. Probation Officer
1 reported she also did not think it was a big deal because she trusted
her boyfriend with that information and did not think he would use it
against her. Probation Officer 1 was asked to explain her job title at the
facility, and she noted that she completes therapy groups with the youth,
does individual checks in with the youth, and will do family therapy to
prepare the youth to return to the community. Probation Officer 1 was
asked if she believed that telling her boyfriend the youth’s names and
specific details about their life was a HIPPA violation she noted that she
knows this is a concern, but she has to give him specific details due to
their relationship. When asked about the specific text message
conversation with Youth A, Probation Officer 1 reported she does not
know how he would have gotten her phone number and that maybe his
mom got it from the parent group. She confirmed Youth A was not on
her caseload and she would only work with him through the group
sessions. Probation Officer 1 was asked if she could give out her
personal phone number to parents or youth, she reported she has
because some parents only text and you cannot do that with the phone
app on her work phone. She reported she does not think it is a big deal
because she has heard Supervisor give her phone number. Probation
Officer 1 reported when a youth list staff in their circle of support, she
could also give her personal number for them to reach out when they
need help. Probation Officer 1 reported Staff 1 has given out her phone
number to the youth and is in conversations with Youth F. She reported
she knows this because Staff 1 asked Probation Officer 1 if she could
give Youth F her phone number because he was asking. She reported
she told Staff 1 she could not give out her phone number. Probation
Officer 1 was asked about Youth B and she reported he was a youth
that left the program right after she got hired. She reported that she was
not his assigned probation officer, but she did text Youth B’s mother
photos from the graduation ceremony of the program. Probation Officer
4

1 reported she never saw Youth B outside of the facility and reported he
did call her from the county jail a couple of times. She reported she
answered the call once but never talked about anything inappropriate.
Probation Officer 1 reported she did not answer any more of his calls
and she stated that his mom called her asking why she would not talk to
Youth B. She reported she never told Chief Administrator or Supervisor
about this contact. She denied ever giving any of the youth her social
media information and denied she had an Only Fans account.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
26, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported he
currently lives within the treatment program at the facility and his
assigned probation officer through the program is Probation Officer 1.
He reported Probation Officer 1 would do check-ins with him on his
feelings and complete family therapy. Youth E reported he was not open
with Probation Officer 1 because he has his own community-based
therapist. Youth E reported he heard the rumor that Probation Officer 1
had an Only Fans page, and he got this information from Youth B and
Youth F. He stated Youth B and Youth F had told him that Probation
Officer 1 was “open” meaning flirting with both the youth and trying to
date them. Youth E reported he never got confirmation of Probation
Officer 1 ever dating a youth.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
26, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported that
he is currently on the detention side of the facility but was previously on
the treatment side. He reported when he was under the treatment side
his assigned probation officer in the program was Probation Officer 1.
Youth D reported Probation Officer 1’s role was like a therapist where
they would do therapeutic check-ins within her office and complete
family therapy. He reported he looked at Probation Officer 1 as a big
sister and kept him on the right track. Youth D reported when he was on
a home pass, from the program, Probation Officer 1 would do check-ins
with Youth D’s mother to make sure things were going smoothly. He
reported when he was released, Probation Officer 1 would still complete
check-ins. He stated that he did FaceTime with Probation Officer 1 to
check in about his mental health and see how other youth in the
program were doing. He reported Probation Officer 1 was on his circle of
support when he discharged meaning that is a person, he could check in
with post-discharge. Youth D reported no concerns about Probation
Officer 1 being unprofessional.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at his home on October 2,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth F reported
Probation Officer 1 was his probation officer while he was within the
program at the facility. He reported that he has not talked, texted, or
seen Probation Officer 1 since being released. Youth F reported he
heard Probation Officer 1 was fired recently but would not fully disclose
who he heard this from beside that it was someone who was in “county”.
Youth F was very guarded within the interview of any information.
5

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October 2,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she has
been employed at the facility for about three years. She reported she
has worked with Probation Officer 1, but she mainly worked on the
detention side of the facility. Staff 1 reported Probation Officer 1 told her
about her Only Fans account and she saw the website link to it. She
reported Probation Officer 1 was fearful of losing her job over it because
a youth that she previously worked with in the school system was in
detention and was telling the youth about it. Staff 1 reported Probation
Officer 1 deleted her account. She reported Probation Officer 1 would
ask a lot about how youth are doing on the detention side of the
program, but it never seemed to be inappropriate. Staff 1 reported
Probation Officer 1 told her Youth B had called her from the county jail
and she would talk to him about the bond process and talk to him about
how things are going. Staff 1 reported she stopped being friends with
Probation Officer 1 because she was causing drama within the facility
between bosses and lying about situations. Staff 1 was asked if she has
talked to any youth who have been discharged from the program. She
reported she has talked to Youth E via text message once, but it was
because she was on his circle of support. Staff 1 reported she gave
Youth E a Google Voice phone number and not her actual phone
number. The text messages were viewed and were deemed
appropriate. Youth E was the first to reach out to Staff 1 and Staff 1
asked about school and a new job for him. The conversation was only
on one date, and she reported she did not see the need for any
continued support so she lost connection with him. Staff 1 reported
Probation Officer 1 encouraged her to be in Youth E’s circle of support.
She denied ever being asked by Youth E for Probation Officer 1’s
personal phone number or ever giving it to them. Staff 1 reported staff
should not be having contact with the youth outside of the facility.
Chief Administrator and Supervisor were interviewed together face
to face at the facility on September 26, 2023, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Chief Administrator and Supervisor reported they were
made aware of these concerns by Probation Officer 2 immediately after
Youth A’s Mother brought the concerns to him. They both reported they
talked with Probation Officer 1 the day the incident was reported.
Probation Officer 1 confirmed it was Probation Officer 1’s phone number
within the screenshots of the text messages. Chief Administrator and
Supervisor both confirmed Youth A was not under Probation Officer 1’s
caseload within the treatment program and Youth A should not have
access to Probation Officer 1’s personal phone number. They both
confirmed that on the personal phone, there is an app to connect with
your work office phone number to make calls and that should have been
used. Chief Administrator reported if a youth was ever to put down a
staff member on their circle of trust at discharge the phone number
should be the main number to the facility so the call can be directed
appropriately. Chief Administrator and Supervisor reported before this
incident they were setting up a meeting to terminate Probation Officer 1
from her position at the facility due to concerns about dishonesty and
6

integrity regarding her relationship with the team of the treatment
program.
Youth A’s Mother was interviewed via phone on September 26,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A’s Mother was
contacted by MDHHS Worker to get Youth A’s phone to be able to
confront him about the text messages. Youth A’s Mother expressed
concerns about him finding out she was on the phone to tell the facility
about this because she did not want him to go backward in the program.
She reported she found these text messages within the iCloud after
Youth A went back to the facility and immediately reported it to
Probation Officer 2. Youth A’s Mother expressed concerns about these
text messages noting she felt that Probation Officer 1 was grooming
Youth A and she wanted her son to be protected.
Youth F’s Probation Officer was interviewed via phone on
September 29, 2023. Youth F’s Probation Officer reported she met with
Youth F on September 28, 2023, and he disclosed that someone told
him that Probation Officer 1 was fired from the facility. She reported he
would not disclose who he heard this from but noted that it was because
she was texting with another youth who was on a home pass. Youth F’s
Probation Officer reported Youth F commented on how the age of
consent in the state is 16 years old, so it is not a big deal. Youth F also
noted that he never saw Probation Officer 1 while in the facility but has
seen her outside of the facility.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on October 23,
2023. MDHHS worker reported there are findings to their
investigation.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Text Messages between Youth A and Probation Officer 1
dated 09/23/2023- Screen shot of the text messages from Youth
A’s phone were reviewed that showed Probation Officer 1’s
personal phone number during Youth A’s home pass. The
message show Probation Officer 1 asking Youth A if he was
going to “slide” once he is discharged from the facility. She
explained to Youth A within he messages that she could not “fw”
(fuck with) Youth B anymore due to him being jealous of her
contacting former youth. Probation Officer 1 explained she broke
her relationship off with Youth B to be single for Youth A when he
gets out of detention, and she wanted to “hook up with” Youth A.
Probation Officer 1 asked Youth A if his mom would “call him out”
if she found out about them. She texted and explained to Youth
A that she would pick him down the street once he is released
from the facility because she is afraid of his mom. Probation
Officer 1 noted in her messages that Youth B tried to blackmail
her by saying that he would tell Probation Officer 2 and
Supervisor about their inappropriate relationship if she would not
7

pay his bond to get out of the county jail. She reported Youth B
also got mad at her for texting with Youth F. Probation Officer
stated she would introduce her friend to Youth D. Within the text
messages Probation Officer 1 tells Youth A how Youth E talked
about her Only Fans page and she had to delete it. Within the
messages Youth A asked Probation Officer 1 if she had been
talking with Youth C and she reported “a little but like that.” She
stated she told Youth C to give Youth A her phone number and
Youth A responded Youth C would not tell him, but Youth F gave
it to him.
- Probation Officer 1’s HR File- Probation Officer 1 was hired at
the end of April 2023. She had no disciplinary actions noted with
in the file prior to this investigation.
- Probation Officer 1’s Training Record- Probation Officer 1 was
up to date on all her training requirements. It noted she
completed “PREA and Inappropriate Relationship with
Residents” training on 04/24/2023. Probation Officer 1 signed off
on a form stating that she was provided a copy of “A Guide for
Prevention and Reporting of Sexual Misconduct with Residents
for Staff, Vendors, Contractors and Volunteers of the 17th Circuit
Court, Family Division at the Kent County Juvenile Detention
Center” on 04/24/2023.
- Probation Officer 1’s employment termination letter
September 26, 2023- This letter is from Chief Administrator
noting as of 09/26/2023, Probation Officer 1 was terminated from
employment due to it being determined that she did not
adequately demonstrate the ability to meet all requirements of
the position. Probation Officer 1 was terminated from the facility
due to the failure to pass her probationary period of employment.
- Kent County Juvenile Detention Center Policies and
Procedures: Relationship with Resident- The relationship
established between a staff member and a resident in the facility
should always be a professional nature. Personal involvement of
a non-professional nature must be avoided both while the youth
is in the detention center and after the resident is released. Staff
members are not permitted to become socially involved with
court wards. Contact with youth outside of the facility must be
reported to the Chief Administrator for their approval.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as Probation Officer 1 was not
following the facilities policy on relationships with a youth.
Probation Officer 1 has been having communication with youth
outside the facility through her personal phone without Chief
Administrator approval. There are concerns crossing professional
boundary lines as witnessed within the text messages with Youth
A and what Youth B has reported via his interview.
8

Consultation Provided:
- During the investigation the following consultation was
provided: a reminder should be made to staff about the
relationship with the youth policy, taking staff off of the
youth’s circle of support, and staff should not be providing
personal phone number to youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0328002 dated 11/21/22; CAP approved 12/1/22.
2023C0000425 dated 6/13/23; CAP approved 7/6/23.
2023C0000596 dated 8/18/23; CAP approved 9/11/23
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10129 Privacy and confidentiality.
Section (1) A facility shall provide for resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Probation Officer 1 was providing confidential information about
youth at the facility to a person who is not employed at the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Probation Officer 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 26, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. When
asked how her boyfriend could be so specific with the youth’s first and
last names in the text messages, Probation Officer 1 reported she gave
him every detail of her day and she discloses the youth’s names. She
reported she did not think was a big deal because she had overheard
Supervisor saying she had talked to her own husband about the youth.
Probation Officer reported she also did not think it was a big deal
because she trusted her boyfriend with that information and did not think
he would use it against her. Probation Officer 1 was asked if she
believed that telling her boyfriend the youth’s names and specific details
about their life was a HIPPA violation she noted that she knows this is a
concern but she has to give him specific details due to their relationship.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October 2,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she has
been trained in HIPPA and Confidentiality at the facility all the time. She
reported they are told they cannot talk about youth or situations with
people outside of being employed at the facility.
Chief Administrator and Supervisor were interviewed together face
to face at the facility on September 26, 2023, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Chief Administrator and Supervisor both reported staff
at any position within the facility should not be talking about the youth to
people outside of the facility.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Probation Officer 1’s HR File- Probation Officer 1 was hired at
the end of April 2023. She had no disciplinary actions noted with
in the file prior to this investigation.
9

- Probation Officer 1’s Training Record- Probation Officer 1 was
up to date on all her training requirements. It noted she
completed “New PO Training with Supervisor” on 04/24/2023
which is where they reviewed the policy of confidentiality.
- Probation Officer 1’s employment termination letter
September 26, 2023- This letter is from Chief Administrator
noting as of 09/26/2023, Probation Officer 1 was terminated from
employment due to it being determined that she did not
adequately demonstrate the ability to meet all requirements of
the position. Probation Officer 1 was terminated from the facility
due to the failure to pass her probationary period of employment.
- Kent County Juvenile Detention Center Policies and
Procedures: Confidentiality – This policy stated, “Detention
staff will not disclose confidential or discretionary information
gained through their court employment to any unauthorized
person.”
Analysis The facility is found in violation of this rule due to Probation Officer
1 disclosing youth personal information to an unauthorized
person.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
October 23, 2023

Cathrine Raftery Date
Licensing Consultant
